text: Laydah Anitae Samani (born 18 February 1992) is a Solomon Islands women's footballer who plays as a forward for Solomon Warriors. ==Career== Samani made her international debut for the Solomon Islands in the country's first women's international match on 9 April 2007, starting in the 2007 OFC Women's Championship match against Papua New Guinea. ==Career statistics== ===International=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- !colspan=3|Solomon Islands |- !Year!!Apps!!Goals |- |2007||5||1 |- |2011||3||3 |- |2015||2||0 |- |2018||3||2 |- !Total!!13!!6 |} ===International goals=== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" |- !No.!!Date!!Venue!!Opponent!!Score!!Result!!Competition |- | 1 || 30 August 2007 || Toleafoa J.S. Blatter Complex, Apia, Samoa || || align=center|1–1 || align=center|1–1 || 2007 South Pacific Games |- | 2 || rowspan=3|2 September 2011 || rowspan=3|Stade PLGC, Nouméa, New Caledonia || rowspan=3| || align=center|1–0 || align=center rowspan=3|4–0 || rowspan=3|2011 Pacific Games |- | 3 || align=center|2–0 |- | 4 || align=center|3–0 |- | 5 || rowspan=2|24 August 2018 || rowspan=2|Churchill Park, Lautoka, Fiji || rowspan=2| || align=center|1–0 || align=center rowspan=2|2–0 || rowspan=2|2018 OFC Women's Nations Cup qualification |- | 6 || align=center|2–0 |} ==References== ==External links== * Profile at oceaniafootball.com Category:1992 births Category:Living people Category:Solomon Islands women's footballers Category:Solomon Islands women's international footballers Category:Women's association football forwards
title: Laydah Samani
